intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. curvatum, commonly known as the curved hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, while its leaves are basal and have a rough, hairy texture. This subspecies is notable for its distinctive curved flower heads and is often found in disturbed soils.
